body.name: SwitchBot Baby Monitor Indoor Camera, 360-degree 1080P Pan Tilt Smart WiFi(2.4G) Pet Camera for Home Security with Motion Detection, Night Vision, Two-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & Google Assistant

features: Clear 1080P Picture - SwitchBot Pan/Tilt Cam displays 24/7 live stream video in full 1080p HD even when mounted in reverse to the ceiling. It can pan/tilt 360° horizontally and 115° vertically.

Instant App Notifications - The camera records video when motion is detected and sends an alert to your phone. Using the video playback feature, you can stay on top of things without having to constantly monitor the app. The 8 infrared LEDs allows you to see every detail in darkness.

Two-Way Audio - The built-in microphone and speaker allow you to see, hear, and speak to anyone who passes by via the Wi-Fi camera (only support 2.4G WiFi) with live view and two-way audio features. Through the SwitchBot app, you can see who’s at your front door and how’s your baby doing.

Privacy Protection - This camera supports up to 128GB SD card local storage (SD card not included) and cloud storage. It transmits data via a secure channel with HTTPS technology, no data will be shared publicly through the Internet and no other devices can access your camera.

Works with Alexa & SwitchBot - You can use your voice to control this security camera without the need for a hub. Or pair with SwitchBot Hub Mini(sold separately) and create even more home automation with other SwitchBot products.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Worried about people entering your home? Someone always invading the fridge? SwitchBot Pan/Tilt Cam helps detect movement and can notify you immediately. With two high-quality motors, Pan/Tilt Cam can rotate 360 degrees to allow you to see your room from all directions clearly in 1080p HD video.

Two high-quality motors Pan/Tilt Cam can rotate 360 degrees to allow you to see your room from all directions. It's time to capture a wider range of view when monitoring (horizontally up to 360º, and vertically up to 115º). Pan/Tilt Cam Part of SwitchBot ecosystem Pan/Tilt Cam More way to store & share. There's a ton of different ways to store and share your data. Including local and cloud storage, and also options to share videos with friends and family. Pan/Tilt Cam

Multiple Area Viewing The SwitchBot Camera series all support 4-way split screen. View multiple places at the same time to monitor you home. Human movement tracking SwitchBot Pan/Tilt Cam is able to distinguish between human movement to stop unnecessary notifications. Automatically track motion When Pan/Tilt Cam detects motion, it will automatically start tracking and recording whatever is in its sight, making sure you'll never miss a thing. Make the most of Home Sharing You can share your camera with other users to allow family members or friends to have access to your camera.

Smart notifications Receive alerts to stay updated on what's going on when you're not around. Enjoy more privacy SwitchBot Pan/Tilt Cam also features an intuitive Privacy Mode that enables your camera lens to be stored away and hidden. Includes night-vision Infrared LED lights make it easier to see in dark rooms. Allowing you to check on sleeping children or even catch pets when they're up to no good. Set preset points 4 preset points can be set, and when setting actions for a scene, you can enable your camera to quickly rotate to a preset point.

Real HD 1080p video Equipped with a 2-megapixel camera and F2.0 aperture, let more light in, making the picture more detailed, ensuring the best results in any lighting conditions. Your privacy is Important to us We know that privacy is important, all your data is encrypted, secure, and safe and is never shared with third-party providers. Meaning you'll have more peace of mind no matter how you store video and images.

Say more with two-way Audio You can communicate with whoever is at home when you're away by using our two-way talk function to see just exactly what's going on at home, great for when keeping an eye on grandparents, children, or pets. Voice command compatible Simply ask Alexa to show you the living room, and you'll be able to keep an eye on children, pets, or just about anything, no matter what you are doing. You can also use commands with Echo Show to allow yourself to see exactly what's going on, even if you're not in the same room.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great camera and great price
reviews.reviewText: Easy to connect. Picture is nice. Has zoom and pan capability along with 2 way audio. For 20 bucks, you can't go wrong. I use this to monitor my pet, but it would work great as a baby monitor, indoor security or whatever you please.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice job SwitchBot!
reviews.reviewText: I kind of bought this on a lark as I love the SwitchBot button toggle. That one is actually my favorite smart device as it can start my record player remotely! So cool. The pan tilt camera is growing on me though. Originally bought it to establish proof of life for the cats when we are traveling. I wasn’t expecting much, given the price, but despite being cheap, it works pretty well. Good v1 design. It is super quiet and I love that I can save the video to a micro SD card. The remote access is pretty good, if a little slow to connect at times. Best of all, the tracking works! Easily follows me and my wife around when we leave it on and usually catches the cats too. I think it is a little spotty at night with the cats but we still get hits. I do wish you had more control over the sensitivity. All in, it is prob the best bang for your buck in the space. I mean it is a v1 design, so don’t expect perfection. It is an affordable and easy to use device that does everything I was looking for. Also the SwitchBot customer service is super cute. Nice job guys!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice picture but have some issues
reviews.reviewText: Have had this running for 2 weeks now, along with a Switchbot Mini, while I am away from my home. 5 days in, this unit went offline but the mini has been working fine. The only good thing I can say about this is that the video quality if excellent when it is working.Had someone to check on the house and restarted this camera so it's back online. Will see how long it stays online this time. I have checked firmware of the camera and it is the latest.While someone was at the house, I got to watch video real time and got recorded video. I have to say I have very mixed feelings about motion tracking. When I am watching real time video, the view kept shifting because the camera detected movements. This became very annoying as it became very hard to see what I am actually trying to see. The the motion tracking video is disappointing as well. I included the one as example. When motion is detected, somehow camera first moves a bit in opposite direction, then a pause, then it moved the other way to catch up with the movement. As you can see in video, by the time it swings back, the person is already gone and camera wasn't able to reacquire. Basically I got a flash of a person passing by and that was it. It would have been better if motion tracking was disabled. Annoying part is that this doesn't happen all the time. 50% of the time it does catch the person again and was able to track the movement.It seems to me that these are all software issues that can be addressed easily. Perhaps motion tracking can be turned off when viewing real time and while it is being controlled by the app.The app is also disappointing in that I can only connect to one camera at a time. On the home screen, you get tiles of cameras available but you can not view the videos in the tiled format. So if you have multiple of these and watch to watch all corners of your house at the same time, this would not work for you. If these cameras work with another app that could allow you the tiled view, I don't know about those yet.Edit: Have not gone offline again so that could be a one time incident.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars (Revised) WiFi not up to standard
reviews.reviewText: I am re-reviewing this item (08/01/2022)----------After contact with the manufacturer, my camera is working fine. When I input my WiFi password, it still puts up a warning. BUT, after a moment or two, that warning goes away and a QR code appears.I never got that QR code before. After letting the camera scan the code, which takes 1-5 seconds, the camera responded and began working on my network.Now my camera is working as it should. My phone, tablet (both Android) and Alexa Show can all work with it just fine.I am not sure what "fixed" the issue, but everything is working.I left the original 1 star review below, but NONE of it applies now. I would recommend this camera for it's small size, good picture quality, low price and features.--- Original review below. See above. NONE OF THIS IS TRUE, NOW! ---I received my unit and within 20 minutes of trying to set it up, I am returning it.When it asked for my WiFi password, I was informed by the app that my password was "too long" and that I needed to make MY WiFi password shorter. It is ~35 characters longThe standard for WiFi passwords is over 60 characters.Needless to say, telling your customers to change their security to meet the product's needs is just plain WRONG!If you have a short (and therefore a little more easily hacked) password, then go ahead. It may be a great product. But when a product demands I lower my security to meet THEIR needs, they can stuff it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Couldnt Get Pass The QR Code
reviews.reviewText: The setup for this camera is ridiculous….i just received mine recently and spent well over 10 hours trying to get pass the QR code…it took forever for it to finally detect it…once it did, i had to connect to 2.4ghz wifi…i did…and after waiting approximately 2 minutes for it…it never connects…mind you i already have one of their cameras (switchbot indoor camera) and had no issues with it connecting to the QR code nor connecting to the wifi…so once i seen this camera, i was like hmmmm ill get this one to…pfft big mistake…not only does it not connect to wifi but the QR code finiding is awful…ill be returing

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Bought for my dogs
reviews.reviewText: Camera is a neat little gadget. Guess I was the idiot thinking it was wireless meaning no wires but it's not. Served the purpose. Voice/audio is off sometime. For the price I guess it works as it's supposed too

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Easy to use. Put it under the crib and everything may look from distance. Also when going to vacation look after cat.
This device has exceeded my expections for the price. My only complaint is the lack of lower range when remotely controlling the camera.

This thing works well for the price.I use it to keep an eye on the dog.Every now and again it won't turn on so I have put it on a home automation switch that I can turn on and off.It was easy to setup.Audio and video are good and it can be panned and tilted.I use it on Android on an S23 Ultra and S22 and it works.Small, unobtrusive.Can ceiling mount.Low cost.Negatives:Must use their servers.Cant access it directly.
Not compatible and the instructions are not that great. Wouldn't even turn on
Works great with our other Switchbot items and the app. Wish the camera was 2 way talk though.
